decision_conditions: <p><span style="line-height:normal"><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">The proposed </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">single storey front to&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">side extension, by reason of </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">its </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">excessive </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">width</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial=""> </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">would result in an obtrusive, bulky and unsatisfactory designed development, which</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial=""> would be </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">obtrusive and incongruous</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial=""> in the street scene, </span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">to the detriment of the character and appearance of the subject building, the adjacent buildings and</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial=""> the locality</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D1 and D11 of The London Plan (2021), Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).&nbsp;</span></span></span><br></p>
description: Single storey front extension incorporating front porch; single storey side extension; demolition of attached garage
